cluster_classes.class_description: Physical components that make up the vehicle door assembly in the urban legend scene.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: the car door and its handle where the scratching is heard and hook is found

members.entity_description: The door of the couple’s vehicle where the scratching sound is heard.
The handle of the car door from which the bloody hook is hanging.

cluster_classes.class_description: Sensory and physical elements that signify danger and escalate fear in the Hook Man urban legend.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: a scratching sound on the car door and a bloody hook hanging from the handle

members.entity_description: An ominous noise heard on the car door that increases the couple’s terror in the Hook Man urban legend.
A hook covered in blood found hanging from the car door handle.

cluster_classes.class_description: Narrative motifs in folklore and urban legends that serve as warnings about hidden dangers, such as abduction threats or harmful supernatural forces.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Stories of strangers luring children with candy... and cursed objects warn listeners about the dangers that lurk in the world.

members.entity_name: strangers luring children with candy (urban legend)
members.entity_description: A cautionary urban legend motif in which strangers attempt to lure or abduct children by offering them candy.
Objects believed to carry a curse that brings misfortune or harm to those who possess them.

args.new_description: Physical components of the vehicle door assembly as they appear within the Hook Man urban legend scene.
args.justification: Aligns the class name/description with its specific narrative function and groups it under a shared Urban Legend Narrative Elements Class_Group with related legend elements.

args.new_description: Sensory and physical cues (such as sounds and objects) that signify danger and escalate fear in the Hook Man urban legend.
args.justification: Refines the label to emphasize these are threat cues within a narrative and connects them via the Urban Legend Narrative Elements Class_Group to related scene components and motifs.

args.new_description: Cautionary motifs in folklore and urban legends (e.g., strangers luring children with candy, cursed objects) that warn about hidden dangers and harmful forces.
args.justification: Clarifies that the motifs are specifically within urban legends and unifies them under the same Urban Legend Narrative Elements Class_Group as other legend-related classes.
